storyInfo: For her first task as head of her own crew, Shana chose to complete the project her father had left unfinished.

attributes.content: Hey, Dad! I've modified your lamp for you!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Don't you all go on about how 'A Billy worker never sees the sun'? Well, this lamp can be your own little sun, look!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Isn't it way brighter than before? I got an engineer to change out one of the Originium circuits. It can go on standby mode for waaay longer now!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Here, I'll help you try it on!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: ...Alright then, put it on for me.
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Oh, don't look so glum. You all have been at this vein for weeks. If anyone can solve this, it's you, Dad.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: And don't forget the lamp! If you go mining with this baby, you'll get results tomorrow, guaranteed! You can then all get paid, and the crew will cheer up.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Yowch! Easy there, kiddo...
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Shana remembers holding the headlamp high that day, chirping as she clumsily put it on for him and reminded him to wear it down to the mine the next day.
That lamp could shine brighter and farther. With it, he would surely see more clearly and finally crack the problem that had been bothering the miners for weeks.
But she doesn't recall his exact reaction. Was it a bittersweet smile on his face as he stared into the dark of night?
The next day, she was in the mine base looking over some blueprints when she heard news of an accident at her dad's project.
Soon after, her dad's crew disbanded.
*phew* I'm tuckered out. I don't know why the chief is so hellbent on taking this project nobody else wants. Ain't it bad enough that one Moleman had to take a fall for that?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Ol' Moleman worked his arse off his whole life, only to end up losing everything he made and his crew. And now the chief wants to follow in her dad's footsteps? What's the deal, here?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Same problem that stumped the old fella's now here to haunt the young'un. Whole mine says it can't be done, but those Molemans just won't listen.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Oh, hey, where'd you get those ciggies? Been a while since I had a smoke.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Picked up some butts, gathered the leaves myself, then rolled them in some newspaper. Here.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*! Right bugger of a taste...
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Mate, just be glad you've got something to smoke. If the chief wasn't covering meals, I couldn't even afford this helmet to go down the mine.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Then there's the safety specialist yapping about. Good thing the chief's got him handled. If he fines me again, my bed's about the only thing I can give as collateral.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: And we don't even know if this job's gonna last. We've been trying to drill through the kilometer depth marker for ages, and the deadline's today, mate...
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: What'd we do if we lose this job... Forget it. We've been fired and hired more times than I can count. I'll do anything, so long as I don't go hungry.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Oh, right, did you hear that ruckus underground? Going all 'thwack, thwack thwack'. Whole mine knows we've got a ghost on our hands, that's why we're always—
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Hey, shut it with that talk. It's the chief.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Everyone here?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Today's our last day down the mine. We haven't hit our targets so far, and if we don't strike the main vein, we can kiss our deal with the investors goodbye.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: If we do find it, though, our prospecting says this might be the biggest vein in the area, which means our paychecks get a lot fatter.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: I know whole lotta crews couldn't dig through that kilometer depth, but if we can, we'll be the first team in the region to make that breakthrough.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: With that rep, we'll be swimming in opportunity. Our skills will get us more work, and more work means more cash. Not to mention, I'll be covering meals as usual!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: No problem, chief! We've spent nearly a month rebuilding the protective layer. Drilling through the kilometer's just a matter of time.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: But we need to get results today...
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Shana joins her crew, patting them on the shoulders.
No need to think too much right now. Just gotta do what we can!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: If we succeed, I'm gonna pull that nitpicky safety specialist over by the ear and let him take a good look!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Haha! Good one.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: But first things first, drill through that kilometer today, find the main vein, and become the most efficient mine in the region.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Not exactly a piece of cake.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Oh, right, did you hear that noise everyone's been talking about, chief? What is that, really?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Isn't everyone saying it's some sorta underground ghost? I've also heard it's a big hunk of ore that can run about.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Since we're all so curious, why don't we dig our way to the truth?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Alright everyone, let's head down!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: ...Did you hear that, Shana?
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Hear what? We've got earplugs in, Dad... Do you mean the drill?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: No. Listen again...
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: There are sounds that don't belong here. Don't you hear them?
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: I don't hear anything. Just regular ol' mine noises. Don't scare me like that, Dad!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: I'm not, Shana...
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Ol' Moleman leans his back against the damp mine wall, slowly sitting down in the darkness. The lamp atop his head shakes and sways, its beam devoured by the endless dark.
Thwack, thwack, thwack...
Shana... Every time I reach a certain depth, I always feel like I'm alone in the entire mine, even if there's someone right next to me.
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Then there's this sound I keep hearing, one I've never heard anywhere else. It rings in my ears all the time, even when I'm wearing ear plugs.
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Maybe it's your heartbeat...?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: If only, sweetheart. At times, Shana, I feel like this sound... is trying to tell me something...
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: 'Turn back', 'turn back', 'turn back'...
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Thwack, thwack, thwack...
A rock trapped between the wall and the descending mining cage clacks from the friction. This gets several miners whispering.
Listen, chief. Isn't this like the sound the ghost is supposed to be making?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: I hear rumors that the ghost is what's stopping us from finding the main vein.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: And you honestly believe that?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: No! If anything, I think we have a shot at making it today.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: After all we've done, reworking the protective layer, gathering Originium data and all, we're just gonna let a ghost scare us? Assuming there even is one.
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Sure, sure. Alright, we're at the bottom now. No more chit-chat, we got work to do. If we want to shut the doubters up, today's our last chance.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Let's get started. Follow the plans from before.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Margin of error confirmed... within three centimeters. Checking rock hardness next...
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Drill bits fixed!
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Alright people, let's get digging!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: In an instant, endless rumbles and booms echo through the mine.
*pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Wait, chief! I think I got something here!
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Let me turn my lamp on...
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: It's coming out in rods, and it's yellow...
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: A-Aren't these... explosives?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: This is the first time we've been this deep, right?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: They look like leftovers from previous excavation teams to you?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Leftover explosives shouldn't blow that easily, but they still might, right?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Heck yeah!
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: ...Any of you lot got experience with excavation?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: ...I've been around long enough to know how excavators get rid of extra explosives.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: It'll take too much time if we go up for help. That good-for-nothing safety specialist must have known about this and set us up! Can we...?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: We all know how to get rid of them, chief, but it's too hot here! You gotta leave it to the pros. I hate to say it, but we have to let the excavators come down and take care of this.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: We can argue for more time later. But now we have to go!
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Alright, fine.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: A hundred, two hundred, three hundred meters... The crew follows the narrow, winding mineshaft, making their way to the cage.
The miners keep their heads down in silence. Shana suddenly senses something and looks around to pinpoint its source.
Wait. I think I smell something...
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: The corner we turned just now, it's a little... Hmm...
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: This is bad! Get down!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: It's hot down here, and we drilled into the explosives earlier, so maybe—
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: EVERYONE, GET DOWN!
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: The explosives?
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough*...
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Drip, drop... Drip, drop...
At first, it was just a small trickle of water running through the wall, but upon the first boom of the explosion, the rocks were brought to their limit, and they crumbled away.
A several-meter-wide crack appears in the ground, releasing a rush of water that quickly pools around the crew's feet.
The odd sound that Shana's father heard, the one that told him to 'turn back', resounded through the underground with extreme clarity.
Thwack, thwack, thwack...!
Wh-What's that sound? D-Do you hear that?
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Is it just me, or am I hearing the ghost? That 'thwack, thwack'...!
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: We must have hit an aquifer! I thought we had those checked...
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: It'll take ages to drain and depressurize all this. Look at how much water there is! Forget goaf water, it's probably an entire underground river!
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Is it just me, or is that 'thwack, thwack' noise getting louder?
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: Thwack, thwack, thwack!
The weary crew quiet down in the face of the clamor.
Could it really be a ghost that's been stopping us?
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: Look chief, the whole reason no crew took this job is because it's too hard. It ain't our fault if we can't hack it today...
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Ghost or no ghost, I don't reckon we can get anything done today. How about we go up and tell them we quit?
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: If we head up now, we might even make it in time for dinner. We'll rest up and find a new gig. What do you say, chief?
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: *sigh* Chief, we've put in so much and got jack in return. Why'd you take the job in the first place?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: We've been mining our entire lives, and there're plenty of jobs out there. What's so special about this one?
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: *hearty laugh* So what do you think about this project? We'll get to learn some new tech and see how a big operation is run. It'll broaden our horizons a bit, yeah?
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: And before you ask, the pay's better, but the work will be tougher too. But you lot are hard workers and fast learners, so I'm confident we can pull this off.
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: *sigh* We've got it rough. Mining ain't easy, but once we finish this job, you'll find more opportunities coming your way, and with them, more cash and a better life.
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Alright, no need to thank me all at once! Settle down, settle down...
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: *reassuring laugh* Go home for now, no worries! Just remember to get your arses here on time tomorrow!
attributes.name: Ol' Moleman

attributes.content: Thanks for taking care of us, boss!
attributes.name: Workers

attributes.content: See you all later!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Take care on the way home!
attributes.name: Shana
Shana
attributes.content: We should head back too, Dad—

attributes.name: Shana
attributes.content: Eh? Dad?
Where'd he run off to all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Shana remembers searching the entire mine base before finding him standing before the seemingly bottomless mineshaft, staring into its gaping darkness with his hands behind his back.
Not too long ago, he had been surrounded by those who trusted him, their optimism about work and the future infectious. But now, he stood alone, gazing into the abyss.
She stood behind her father, not daring to approach. After what felt like an eternity, she saw him take a deep breath and exhale ever so slowly.
She remembers seeing her father bending down so low that he resembled one of those drills down the mine that had lost power.
It was a scene she had witnessed many, many times.
Dad... What's going on...?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: You're right. We've been miners our whole lives, and every job's pretty much the same.
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: Doesn't matter if we strike gold or not, we'll still have to find some other work after.
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: Your dad wanted us to nail this project to make a name for ourselves. Then we could land tougher gigs and earn more. He meant well, chief.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: But whatever extra we make won't mean much against the medical bills anyway. So it's really okay if we bail.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Do you lot really believe there's a ghost down here?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Do you really believe that there's a ghost stopping us from finding the vein?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Not exactly... But look, chief. We somehow dug into an underground river and that spooky sound just won't stop. Nobody really knows what's going on, but we're all...
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: We'll just take whatever job comes our way. Scraping by is good enough for us.
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: So you don't believe in the ghost, but you still want to stop here...?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: But don't you want to go and see what's outside Rim Billiton?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: You were the only ones still mining after dad's crew disbanded. I've been down the mines with you plenty of times. The reason I brought you all back and took on this project again is to prove to everyone—
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: That we have the skills to do what others can't, and that we deserve to be treated and paid fairly.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: And we deserve to see a better future, even if it's just a teeny bit better!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Haha... Chief...
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: That sounds good and all, but for us, we're just happy to get our paychecks and live to spend them.
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: As for our 'future'...
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: The miners look at one another, smiling bitterly while shaking their heads.
They take a deep breath, then exhale ever so slowly. They lean against the damp wall and slump down to the ground, heads buried so deep, like drills out of power.
Shana can almost see her father in them.
(Have they always thought this was impossible? That we'll never make our way out of Rim Billiton?)
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: (No wonder Dad seemed so gloomy and even set aside money to pay his crew in case the job went bust. He knew they wouldn't make it.)
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: (Did it ever cross his mind, too?)
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: ('If I weren't working with this crew but had five or ten of me, maybe I'd have gotten the job done already')
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: (Maybe Dad never realized that deep down, he had considered his crew a burden.)
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Thwack, thwack, thwack!
Oh, that noise's back again...
attributes.name: Hard-Working Miner

attributes.content: Let’s go back up, chief. We're wasting time here. It's not like we can keep drilling down.
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: Wait. I just want to try one last time.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Chief?
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: This isn't a problem that can be fixed in one try. We—
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: I know. It's just... If I leave now without giving it one last shot, I know I'll regret it.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Shana lifts her drill and shield, feeling their weight in her hands.
My drill's still got some juice left in it, and there's enough concrete in my shield to block a few leaks. As for me, maybe...
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Maybe I only have enough strength to last another half an hour.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: But even so, I want to give it one last try. Maybe if I take a different direction, I'll find the vein. Maybe if I push just a bit harder, we'll achieve what we couldn't.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: I always believed that as long as we worked together, with our hands and our skills... We'd find ourselves a future.
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: The miners begin to scatter, many shuffling back to the cage to wait. Their headlamps form bobbing beads of light in the darkness.
They stop in their tracks and dip their heads to look at the young lady, their new foreman on the first job she took for them.
Shana slings her drill across her shoulder, stoops down a bit, then walks deeper into the bowels of Terra.
Thwack! Thwack! Thwack!
The sound continues: a ghost, as the miners claim, haunting the mine; the warning that urged her father to return. But to Shana, it felt like something else...
Are you telling me to go this way?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Well then, now or never!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Thwack! Thwack! Thwack!
Down! Down! Down!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: At this depth, Shana feels that she is alone. The odd clank grows clearer than ever. She musters up her depleting strength and keeps digging towards it.
To her surprise, a bright light can be seen from the cracks her drill made.
...Light?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Why's there light here?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Thwack! Thwack! Thwack!
As she digs deeper, the light grows stronger, almost blinding. Shana never imagined anything like this so deep underground.
With the last of her strength, she drives the drill downward. Suddenly, the rocks part like pages in a book, unveiling the glimmering ore that time itself had written.
The drill burns through the last of its fuel and ceases its rumbling cry. Shana gasps for breath as she stumbles to check if this is the vein they have been searching for.
A small face bearing a fuzzy beard and a damp nose suddenly pokes out of the crack. It squeezes its mouth though, sniffling as it takes in air.
Sniff sniff!
Sniff sniff!!
attributes.name: Sandbeast

attributes.content: Eh?!
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: The sandbeast startles, squeezing its entire body out of the crack, a miner's lamp somehow firmly attached to its back.
It scarpers and clatters its way through the dark mine, lighting up the drill in Shana's hand, the bubbling underground river, and the faces of the miners that it passes.
Thwack! Thwack! Thwack! The headlamp on its back strikes against the rock walls, thwacking as it goes.
A sandbeast?! Here? How'd it even get down here? That's the source of our sound?
attributes.name: Weary Miner

attributes.content: Look there! Those rocks look like they're part of the transition zone. I reckon the chief dug right past the aquifer and struck the vein!
attributes.name: Diligent Miner

attributes.content: That... Isn't that the headlamp I gave Dad...?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Why's it on the back of a sandbeast?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: A few impatient miners rush over, lifting their lanterns to inspect the glimmering ore.
Chief! This is it! It's the vein!
attributes.name: Excited Miner

attributes.content: It's at the right depth! We managed to break the kilometer bottleneck! We found the vein!
attributes.name: Overjoyed Miner

attributes.content: We... We did it?
attributes.name: Excited Miner

attributes.content: We actually did it?!
attributes.name: Excited Miner

attributes.content: Shana bends down to examine the passage the sandbeast has dug. Two, five, seven meters...
It dug a passage seven meters long, and in the process, somehow managed to get a left-behind headlamp stuck onto its back.
Seven meters...
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Didn't Dad say we were within spitting distance of the vein?
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: *phew*
attributes.name: Shana

attributes.content: Thwack! Thwack! Thwack!
The outer casing of the lamp can no longer hold against all these strikes, and it falls onto the ground.
Shana picks up the fallen casing and looks at her father's name, carved by her own hand. This is the lamp she made just for him, wishing him a successful project.
She told him that if he used it, success would surely come, and his crew would have a better future. Even if it was only a glimmer of hope.
The sandbeast continues to rush to the upper levels of the mine, its clanking gradually fading into the distance, but the light shines on.
Shana looks up and sees a sunrise deep within the mine.
